newsitem.title: USA: MGE spring wheat ends lower, March sets new low.
newsitem.headline: MGE spring wheat ends lower, March sets new low.

text.p: MGE spring wheat futures ended lower with March closing near its new low set during the day, on a host of bearish inputs, but bull-spreading and intermarket spreading with CBOT wheat curbed losses, traders said.
Wheat was pressured by news at the midsession that the EU nearly doubled wheat export refunds to 6.9 Ecus from 13 Ecus.
Earlier weakness came from the USDA's lackluster weekly wheat export sales data.
Bull-spreading caused the Dec/March inverse to widen to 13 cents a bushel late after having opened at around 10 cents.
MGE spring wheat closed 2-3/4 to 7-1/4 cents per bushel lower, with Dec down 2-3/4 cents at $4.06-1/4. March set a new contract low at $3.91 before settling at $3.91-1/4, down 7-1/4 cents on the day.

Frontier Futures bought one million Dec bushels and sold 700,000 March, traders said. LFG bought one million March and sold one million December and 2.3 million March. Benson-Quinn bull-spread one million Dec/March at between 10 and 10-1/2 cents per bushel, sources said.
MGE barley futures did not trade and therefore closed unchanged.
